III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 01/27/2025, a youth alleged a staff member hit a youth on the
side. Cameras were reviewed and the incident was not observed.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 02/04/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/31/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth A stated Staff 1 called him “soft” for an
unknown reason and directed Youth A to go down the bedroom
hallway. Youth A stated Staff 1 followed Youth A and punched
Youth A’s left side one time when they were halfway down the
bedroom hallway. Youth A stated the other youths were in the
common area and did not witness the incident. Youth A stated he
did not recall the other staff that worked the shift and does not
know if the other staff witnessed this incident. Youth A stated he
was seen by a nurse for pain on the left side of his torso. Youth A
stated the pain went away.
Youth B was interviewed on 02/10/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth B stated Youth A became angry when Staff 1
turned off the inappropriate music playing on the unit. Youth B
stated Youth A and Staff 1 went down the bedroom hallway, but
he does not recall hearing or seeing what happened next.
Youth C was interviewed on 02/10/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth C stated a staff (does not recall who) directed
Youth B to turn off the music because it was inappropriate. Youth
C stated Youth A wanted the music on and started to argue with
Staff 1 about keeping the music on. Youth C stated Staff 1 said,
2

“Stop crying” to Youth A and Youth A “attacked” Staff 1 by the
back wall. Youth C stated staff (does not recall who) immediately
intervened by holding Youth A away from Staff 1. Youth C stated
Youth A followed Staff 1 down the bedroom hallway and he does
not know what happened next.
Youth D and Youth E were interviewed separately on 02/10/2025
at Mott Childrens Residence. Youth D and Youth E stated they
were not on the unit when Youth A and Staff 1 argued about the
music playing on the unit. Youth D and Youth E stated they heard
about the incident and Staff 1 has not worked the unit since the
incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/31/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Staff 1 stated Staff 4 redirected Youth B to turn off the
inappropriate music he was playing on the unit. Staff 1 stated
Youth A became upset once the music was turned off. Staff 1
stated he got up from the staff desk and pulled out a coloring book
from the television cabinet to settle Youth A down because Youth
A likes to color. Staff 1 stated Youth A got up from the bench,
approached him and pushed him towards the back wall. Staff 1
stated One to One Worker and a female staff (does not recall
who) immediately stepped between them and Staff 1 moved away
and walked down the bedroom hallway. Staff 1 stated Youth A
and staff followed him down the bedroom hallway. Staff 1 stated
Youth A swung at him. Staff 1 stated he exited the bedroom
hallway to the outside courtyard and Youth A and staff followed.
Staff 1 stated Youth A swung towards him again. Staff 1 stated
Medical Aid opened the door and Staff 1 re-entered the unit. Staff
1 stated he did not verbally or physically engage with Youth A
during this incident. Staff 1 stated he was reassigned for the
remainder of the shift and has not worked with Youth A since this
incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/31/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 verbally redirected Youth A to get
ready for shift change and have a seat on the bench in the
common area. Staff 2 stated Youth A said, “I’m about to smack
him” in reference to Staff 1, got up from the bench, walked up and
pushed Staff 1 into the back wall. Staff 2 stated Youth A then tried
to grab Staff 1’s neck with both hands. Staff 2 stated a female staff
(does not recall who) physically stepped between Youth A and
Staff 1. Staff 2 stated she did not witness Staff 1 engage
inappropriately with Youth A in this incident. Staff 2 stated she did
not have further details.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed on 02/10/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 directed Youth B to turn off his
inappropriate music. Staff 3 stated Youth A became upset once
the music was turned off and tried to engage Staff 1 in a physical
altercation. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 walked away but Youth A
grabbed and pushed Staff 1 into the back wall and she and
another female staff (does not recall who) stepped between and
separated Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 moved away
from the back wall, walked down the bedroom hallway and exited
the unit with Youth A following. Staff 3 stated she remained on the
unit to supervise the other youths.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 02/10/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Staff 4 stated she directed Youth B to turn off his
inappropriate music due to the profanity in the lyrics. Staff 4 stated
Youth A wanted the music played and became upset. Staff 4
stated a staff (does not recall who) explained to Youth A why the
music was inappropriate. Staff 4 stated Youth A approached Staff
1 and tried to attack him by the back wall. Staff 4 stated Staff 1
walked down the bedroom hallway and exited the unit as she tried
to redirect Youth A. Staff 4 stated she followed Youth A into the
back courtyard. Staff 4 stated she did not witness Staff 1 hit Youth
A in the bedroom hallway or in the courtyard.
One to One Worker (OOW) was interviewed on 02/10/2025 at
Mott Children Residence. OOW stated she entered the unit when
she heard a commotion. OOW stated she saw Youth A follow
Staff 1 down the bedroom hallway with other staff present. OOW
stated Staff 1 exited the unit through the door at the end of the
bedroom hallway and Youth A remained on the unit. OOW stated
she did not witness Staff 1 hit Youth A in the bedroom hallway.
One to One Supervisor (OOS) was interviewed on 01/31/2025 at
Mott Childrens Residence. OOS stated she spoke with Youth A
once he settled down after this incident with Staff 1. OOS stated
Youth A told her that the left side of his torso hurt. OOS stated she
did not observe Youth A with any bruising or swelling on the left
side of his torso but Youth A was evaluated by a nurse. OOS
stated Youth A did not allege Staff 1 caused this pain.
Medical Aid was interviewed on 02/04/2025 by phone. Medical
Aid stated she responded to an assistance call from Staff 4.
Medical Aid stated she arrived on the unit and saw Staff 2 and
Staff 4 blocking Youth A from Staff 1 in the bedroom hallway.
Medical Aid stated Staff 2 and Staff 4 asked Youth A more than
once what was going on. Medical Aid stated Youth A went around
4

Staff 2 and Staff 4 and followed Staff 1 to the back courtyard.
Medical Aid stated she verbally redirected Youth A to return to the
unit, but he remained outside with Staff 2 and Staff 4. Medical Aid
stated Staff 1 returned to the unit. Medical Aid stated she did not
witness Staff 1 verbally or physically engage with Youth A in this
incident.
Video Reviewed:
01/27/2025 video footages were reviewed. Video footages do not
have sound.
Video of the unit’s common area shows Youth A sitting on a bench
as Staff 1 walks up to a cabinet by the bench and opens a cabinet
door. There are no signs of Youth A and Staff 1 interacting. Youth
B, Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 are also
in the common area. Youth A gets up from the bench and walks
towards Staff 1. Staff 1 steps away from the cabinet. Youth A and
Staff 1 stand face to face near the middle of the common area.
Youth A pushes Staff 1 and grabs Staff 1’s upper body with both
hands. Staff 1’s arms are around Youth A’s arms and upper body
as he tries to move away from Youth A. Youth A continues to
move and push until Staff 1 is up against the back wall. Two
female staff and unit youths immediately move towards Youth A
and Staff 1 at the start of the incident. Several female staff arrive
on the unit as Staff 1 moves away from Youth A and heads down
the bedroom hallway. Youth A follows Staff 1 with several staff
standing around and between Youth A and Staff 1. A female staff
holds Youth A’s right wrist but Youth A breaks the hold and swings
his arm towards Staff 1 while in the middle of the bedroom
hallway. Staff 1 runs out the door at the end of the bedroom
hallway. The other youths on the unit remain in the common area.
Outside video footage shows Staff 1 standing in front of the closed
door. Staff 1 moves away from the door and walks several steps
towards the staff parking lot. Youth A and two female staff exit
from this door. Youth A moves towards Staff 1 but the two female
staff stand between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 1 returns to the
door. The door opens and Staff 1 steps back into the bedroom
hallway. Youth A tries but is unable to open the door. Youth A
walks away followed by two female staff.
Documentation Reviewed:
Staff 1 wrote an incident report dated 01/27/2025 that coincides
with his interview of this incident with Youth A.
5

Mott Childrens Residence nursing note dated 01/27/2025 at 3:50
PM states Youth A declined outside medical attention for pain to
his side when touched. Youth A received ibuprofen.
Mott Childrens Residence nursing note dated 01/29/2025 at 3:17
PM states Youth A re-evaluated for his left side pain from
01/27/2025. Youth A denied pain.
Mott Childrens Residence utilizes Therapeutic Crisis Intervention
(TCI) verbal de-escalation and physical management model.
Staff 1 last completed TCI training on 11/26/2024.
Staff 2 last completed TCI training on 08/2/2024.
Staff 3 last completed TCI training on 11/22/2024.
Staff 4 last completed TCI training on 11/19/2024.
Medical Aid last completed TCI training on 11/19/2024.
One to One Worker last completed TCI training on 11/18/2024.
One to One Supervisor last completed TCI training on 11/22/2024.
Mott Childrens Residence physical intervention policy and
procedure states the agency utilizes Therapeutic Crisis
Intervention and “hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body” is prohibited.
Tour Observation:
Upon entering the unit, the kitchen is to the right and the dining
room table is to the left. Moving forward is the common area. The
staff office and joining laundry room is to the left of the common
area. To the right in the common area is a bench. Next to the
bench is a television resting on a long rectangular cabinet. The
common area has several couches and a staff desk. To the left of
the back wall is the bedroom hallway. Two youth bathrooms and
youth bedrooms line this hallway. At the end of this hallway is a
door that leads to an outdoor courtyard.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance of not using physical
punishment. Interviews and video do not support the allegation
that Staff 1 punched Youth A on the left side of his torso.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
